definition: not yet/did not/have not/not/8th earthly branch: 1-3 p.m., 6th solar month (7th July-6th August), year of the Sheep/ancient Chinese compass point: 210°
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next
Futurism (artistic and social movement of the 20th century)
Futurism (artistic and social movement of the 20th century)

sentences.english: Knowlegde can change your fate and English can accomplish your future.
sentences.chinese: 知识改变命运，英文成就未来。

sentences.english: This is where the future will be won.
sentences.chinese: 这才是我们赢得未来的基础。

sentences.english: Young heirs to future-hold, city grows more radiant.
sentences.chinese: 青年累代承未来，城市连年添华彩。

sentences.english: Avoid use of future tense; it is rarely necessary.
sentences.chinese: 避免使用未来式，这是很少需要的。

sentences.english: Sara is asking Yang Pei about her future plans.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉正在问杨佩关于未来的打算。

sentences.english: And it’s goingto be up to you to make an even bigger difference over the next 40years.
sentences.chinese: 未来40年更大的改变也将取决于你们。

sentences.english: He says the new facility may make future tests more realistic.
sentences.chinese: 他说，新的设施可能使未来的测试变得更现实。

sentences.english: Nokia said the N8 would be widely available in coming weeks."The
sentences.chinese: 诺基亚称，N8将在未来几周内得到广泛应用。

sentences.english: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams. ---E. Roosevelt.
sentences.chinese: 未来属于那些坚信他们梦中之美的人们。

sentences.english: However, a participant took the view that the number of seats should dovetail with the future constitutional system.
sentences.chinese: 但有嘉宾认为，议席数目须与未来的政制衔接。

sentences.english: But in future chips, cores’ bandwidth requirements could fluctuate wildly.
sentences.chinese: 但在未来芯片中，核心的带宽需求会剧烈波动。

sentences.english: Mio Wei stressed that over the next five years is the critical period of China's industrial transformation and upgrading.
sentences.chinese: 苗圩强调，未来五年是我国工业转型升级的攻坚时期。

sentences.english: The odds are that the US would stay flattish for years to come.
sentences.chinese: 在未来若干年，美国经济都会表现平平。

sentences.english: Hence, future generations may have a stronger demand for wilderness areas than current generations .
sentences.chinese: 现在和未来的几代人对荒野面积的需求会更强烈。

sentences.english: The drawbacks and the development trend of PLSS are put forward in the end.
sentences.chinese: 最后，提出了其存在的缺点和未来发展方向。

sentences.english: Take me where my future's lyin', St. Elmo's Fire.
sentences.chinese: 永远给我照亮未来，圣埃尔莫火焰。

definition: outlook/prospect/to look ahead/to look forward to
auxiliary verb introducing future action: may (be able to)/will (cause)/should (enable)/going to
to have a promising future/to have bright prospects
immediately/at once/at that moment/at the moment
